cursor.general.aiRules: Always read and follow .cursorrules file in the project root
NO CODE DUPLICATION - If you write the same code twice, extract it into a utility/component/hook
NO HARDCODING - All values must come from constants/theme/config files
ALWAYS REUSE - Check existing components/utils/hooks before creating new ones
STRICT DESIGN PATTERNS - Follow established patterns without exception
UTILITY FIRST - Extract reusable logic into utility functions in utils/ directory
COMPONENT REUSABILITY - Create generic, composable components instead of specific ones
DRY PRINCIPLE - Don't Repeat Yourself - ever
ALWAYS use TypeScript - no .js or .jsx files
ALWAYS use CSS variables from theme - never hardcode colors/spacing
ALWAYS provide dark mode styles - every component needs [data-theme='dark'] overrides
ALWAYS lazy load tools and pages - use React.lazy() and Suspense
ALWAYS memoize - use useMemo, useCallback, and memo appropriately
ALWAYS use theme context - use useTheme() hook, never useState for theme
ALWAYS follow naming conventions - PascalCase for components, camelCase for hooks, UPPER_SNAKE_CASE for constants
Before writing code: Check if logic exists, can be extracted to utility, or can reuse existing component
Button contrast rules: Light theme uses white text on black accent, dark theme uses black text on white accent
cursor.chat.customRules: Read and strictly follow .cursorrules file. Focus on code reusability, no duplication, no hardcoding, proper design patterns, and DRY principles.
